title: César La Paglia
text:
Cesar Osvaldo La Paglia (born 25 February 1979 in <a href="Buenos%20Aires">Buenos Aires</a>) is an <a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="midfielder%20%28football%29">midfielder</a>.
La Paglia started his career at <a href="Argentinos%20Juniors">Argentinos Juniors</a> but he was soon sold to Argentine team <a href="Boca%20Juniors">Boca Juniors</a>. In his first spell with Boca he was part of three <a href="Primera%20Division%20Argentina">League</a> titles. In 2001, he moved to <a href="Talleres%20de%20C%C3%B3rdoba">Talleres de Córdoba</a> but in 2003 he returned to Boca for a second spell with the club. It was during this brief spell at Boca that he won the <a href="Copa%20Libertadores">Copa Libertadores</a>.
Between 2004 and 2006 he played for <a href="Spain">Spanish</a> side <a href="CD%20Tenerife">CD Tenerife</a>, in 2006 he moved to <a href="Vit%C3%B3ria%20F.C.">Vitória F.C.</a> and in 2007 he moved to Independiente Medellín. During the transfer window in January, the Chinese club of <a href="Wuhan%20Optics%20Valley%20F.C.">Wuhan Guanggu</a> signed him for a one-year contract. On May 11, 2008 he was released from Wuhan Guanggu and spent the second half of 2008 with <a href="Defensor%20Sporting">Defensor Sporting</a> of <a href="Uruguay">Uruguay</a>.
In 2009 La Paglia returned to Argentina to join <a href="San%20Mart%C3%ADn%20de%20Tucum%C3%A1n">San Martín de Tucumán</a>.
In 2014, played in a benefit game for Lautaro Aued friend's team. Scoring 13 goals in a row.
En el 2014 jugó un partido para Paredón en el torneo de Ciudad Universitaria
